conclusion: To determine the friction force exerted by block A on the inclined plane with cylinder B, analyze forces on both block A and cylinder B.
Block A is on an inclined plane at θ = 37°.
Block A is on an inclined plane at θ = 30° with cylinder B between A and the plane.
Forces acting on block A at θ = 37° include gravitational force components and friction force.
Equation along the slope: Mg sin 37° = f.
Equation perpendicular to the slope: N = Mg cos 37°.
Forces acting on cylinder B include gravitational force, normal force from the plane, and friction force from block A.
Forces acting on block A at θ = 30° include gravitational force component, friction force, and normal force from cylinder B.
Equation along the slope for A: Mg sin 30° = f.
Equation perpendicular to the slope for A: N = Mg cos 30°.
The friction force exerted by block A on the inclined plane at θ = 30° with cylinder B is 2mg.
